how_it_works.title: How It Works
how_it_works.step1_description: Make sure your Notion page is already publicly shared. Copy the link and paste it into our system.
how_it_works.step2_description: Choose a password that will be required for anyone trying to access your page.
how_it_works.step3_description: You'll receive a link like notionlock.com/p/abc123. Only those with the password can view your Notion page.

accessibility.title: Accessibility Statement
accessibility.description: Our commitment to ensuring NotionLock is accessible to everyone, including people with disabilities.
accessibility.commitment_text: We believe that the web should be available and accessible to anyone, regardless of circumstance and ability. To fulfill this, we aim to adhere as strictly as possible to the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1 at the AA level, which defines guidelines for improving accessibility for people with disabilities.
accessibility.measures_text: We have taken the following measures to ensure accessibility:
accessibility.measure_1: The site's structure is semantic and logical, making it easier for screen readers to navigate.
accessibility.measure_2: We ensure that all interactive elements are accessible via keyboard.
accessibility.measure_3: Text alternatives are provided for non-text content.
accessibility.measure_4: Our design maintains a sufficient color contrast between text and backgrounds.
accessibility.measure_5: The site is responsive and usable on different screen sizes.
accessibility.feedback_text: We welcome your feedback on the accessibility of NotionLock. If you encounter any barriers or have suggestions, please let us know. You can contact us through the channels provided on our 'About Us' page.
accessibility.last_updated: This statement was last updated on June 30, 2025.

about_page.title: About Us: The Story of NotionLock
about_page.p1: NotionLock was born from a simple but fundamental need: to make sharing Notion content secure, controlled, and accessible to everyone. We are a team of developers and productivity enthusiasts who, using Notion daily, recognized the lack of a simple way to password-protect individual pages.
about_page.mission_p1: Our mission is to offer an intuitive, free, and secure tool that gives Notion users full control over their content. We believe that sharing information should never come at the expense of privacy. We want to bridge the gap between Notion's flexibility and the need for granular protection, allowing creators, teams, and individuals to share their work with maximum peace of mind.
about_page.why_li1: Security First: Your security is our priority. We use industry-standard security practices to ensure your content remains protected.
about_page.why_li2: Always Free: NotionLock is an ad-supported service, which allows us to offer password protection at no cost to our users.
about_page.why_li3: Ease of Use: We designed the interface to be as simple and intuitive as possible. In just a few clicks, your Notion page is protected.
about_page.why_li4: Developed by Enthusiasts: We are Notion users ourselves. This means we understand your needs and are committed to evolving NotionLock to meet them.
about_page.future_p1: We are constantly working to improve NotionLock. We are exploring new features such as login page customization, visit analytics, and advanced integrations. Our goal is to make NotionLock the go-to tool for securely sharing Notion content.
about_page.future_p2: Thank you for choosing NotionLock. We are excited to have you with us on this journey.

accessibility_page.title: Accessibility Statement
accessibility_page.p1: NotionLock is committed to ensuring that our services are accessible to all people, regardless of their abilities. We believe that everyone deserves a barrier-free web experience and we are constantly working to improve the accessibility and usability of our site.
accessibility_page.commitment_p1: Our goal is to adhere as closely as possible to the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.1, Level AA, published by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). These guidelines explain how to make web content more accessible for people with disabilities. Conformance with these guidelines helps us make the web more user-friendly for everyone.
accessibility_page.measures_p1: To ensure an accessible experience, we have implemented the following measures:
accessibility_page.measures_li1: Semantic Structure: We use semantic HTML to ensure that the page structure is logical and easily navigable with screen readers.
accessibility_page.measures_li2: Keyboard Navigation: All site functionality is accessible via keyboard navigation, without requiring the use of a mouse.
accessibility_page.measures_li3: Alternative Text: We provide alternative text for all significant images to describe their content to screen reader users.
accessibility_page.measures_li4: Color Contrast: We maintain a high contrast between text and background to ensure readability.
accessibility_page.measures_li5: Responsive Design: Our site is designed to display correctly on a wide range of devices and screen sizes.
accessibility_page.feedback_p1: We are always looking for ways to improve. If you encounter accessibility issues on our site, or if you have suggestions on how we can improve, please contact us. Your feedback is essential to us.
accessibility_page.last_updated: This statement was last updated on August 16, 2025.

faq_page.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq_page.q1_answer: Yes, the service is and will always be 100% free. We support ourselves through non-invasive banner ads on some pages. There are no hidden costs, premium plans, or usage limitations.
faq_page.q2_title: Are my data and Notion pages secure?
faq_page.q2_answer: Absolutely. Security is our top priority. We never read or store the content of your Notion pages. The connection is encrypted, and passwords are handled securely. Our code is public for maximum transparency.
faq_page.q3_title: How do you make money if the service is free?
faq_page.q3_answer: Our business model is based on advertising revenue generated from banners on the site (excluding those on users' protected pages). This allows us to cover our operating costs and continue to offer the service for free.
faq_page.q4_title: Can I customize the password page?
faq_page.q4_answer: We do not currently offer extensive customization options, but it is one of the features we are considering for the future. Our current goal is to keep the service as simple and straightforward as possible.
faq_page.q5_title: What happens if I forget the password for a page?
faq_page.q5_answer: For security reasons, we have no way to recover the password you have set. If you lose the password, you will need to delete the protected page from your NotionLock dashboard and create a new one with a new password.
faq_page.q6_title: Are there any limits on the number of pages I can protect?
faq_page.q6_answer: No, there is no limit. You can protect as many Notion pages as you want, for free.
faq_page.q7_title: Does NotionLock work with free Notion accounts?
faq_page.q7_answer: Yes, NotionLock works perfectly with any type of Notion account, both free and paid. The only requirement is that the page you want to protect is publicly shareable.

privacy_page.title: Privacy Policy
privacy_page.intro_p1: Welcome to NotionLock. Your privacy is critically important to us. This Privacy Policy describes what data we collect, how we use and protect it. By using NotionLock, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy.
privacy_page.data_p1: We collect the following categories of information:
privacy_page.data_li1: Information you provide: When you register, we collect your email address. When you protect a page, we collect the URL of the Notion page you want to protect and the password you set (in encrypted format).
privacy_page.data_li2: Usage Data: We collect information about how you interact with our service, such as pages visited, features used, and basic statistics about visits to your protected pages (visit count, not who visits).
privacy_page.data_li3: Cookies and Similar Technologies: We use cookies to manage user sessions and for the operation of advertising services. You can control the use of cookies through your browser settings and our consent banner.
privacy_page.usage_p1: We use your data for the following purposes:
privacy_page.usage_li1: To provide and maintain our service.
privacy_page.usage_li2: To manage your account and your protected pages.
privacy_page.usage_li3: To communicate with you, for example, to send you service-related notifications.
privacy_page.usage_li4: To monitor the usage of our service and improve it.
privacy_page.usage_li5: To display relevant advertisements that allow us to keep the service free.
privacy_page.security_p1: The security of your data is our priority. We take industry-standard security measures, such as password encryption (hashing) and HTTPS connection, to protect your information. However, no method of transmission over the Internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure, so we cannot guarantee absolute security.
privacy_page.sharing_p1: We do not sell or rent your personal data to third parties. We may share aggregated and non-identifiable information with partners for market analysis. We work with third-party service providers (such as hosting providers and advertising services like Google AdSense) who have access to your data only to perform tasks on our behalf and are obligated not to disclose or use it for any other purpose.
privacy_page.rights_p1: You have the right to access, update, or delete your personal information. You can manage your pages and your account directly from the dashboard. If you wish to completely delete your account, you can contact us.
privacy_page.changes_p1: We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page. You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes.
privacy_page.contact_p1: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, you can contact us through the information provided on our 'About Us' page.
